translated: Höijer, Walter Teodor, director, from Halmstad, born on March 7th, 1892 in Tiflis, Georgia, to missionary Nils H. and Anna Dahlman. Married on the 19th of xx to Hanna Bröms. Children: Kersti, born in 1920. He obtained a degree in business administration in Uppsala in 1917. He was an assistant at the state central agency from 1918 to 1919, in the financial department in 1919, and a bureau inspector in the control force from 1919 to 1930. He was the managing director of System A-B in Halmstad since 1930. He was the chairman of the fuel dealers association in Halland's cities and of the Halmstad rowing club from 1941 to 1942, the vice chairman of Halland's firstborn society since 1945, a member of the Systembolaget executive committee from 1946, a member of the Gothenburg trade bank's board of directors since 1945, the chairman of the Halmstad art club since 1941, a member of the Halland art association since 1946, a board member of the Halmstad nature protection association since 1933, and initiated the establishment of the Halland art association's art collection and the golf course at Tylösand. He travelled to Germany and France twice, in 1921 to Germany and in 1933 to France. He has published "Songs from Vilshärad" and "Hallandssång" (1944), with music by Sven Welin, and "Miniatures" (1947), with music by Sven Båveudde. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, the Commemorative Medal Pro Patria, and the French Order of Academic Palms.

event.name: Establishment of Halland Art Association's Art Collection
